intro: Draba laxa var. gracilis, commonly known as slender whitlowgrass, is a low-growing, flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in the spring. The plant has basal leaves that are narrow and linear, and its stems are typically covered in fine, soft hairs. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Draba laxa var. gracilis is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with characteristic cruciform flowers.
